definition: a schedule containing names of persons summoned as jurors, the group of persons so summoned, jury sense 1
examples: summoned a panel of 40 citizens for jury duty
The 12-person panel arrived at a guilty verdict.

definition: a group of persons selected for some service (such as investigation or arbitration), a group of persons who discuss before an audience a topic of public interest, panel discussion, a group of entertainers or guests engaged as players in a quiz or guessing game on a radio or television program
examples: The panel agreed to accept questions following the discussion.
The quiz show included a panel of three players.

definition: a separate or distinct part of a surface: such as

a thin usually rectangular board set in a frame (as in a door), a usually sunken or raised section of a surface set off by a margin, a flat usually rectangular piece of construction material (such as plywood or precast masonry) made to form part of a surface
a vertical section of fabric (such as a gore)
comic strip, a frame of a comic strip
examples: The comic strip was composed of four panels.

definition: a thin flat piece of wood on which a picture is painted, a painting on such a surface
a section of a switchboard (as for circuit breakers or for a telephone exchange)
examples: … he entered the basement to work on the electrical panel and circuits …

definition: a usually vertical mount for controls or dials (as of instruments of measurement)
examples: Most microwave ovens have a control panel with numbers from 0 to 9.

definition: to furnish or decorate with panels
